Package model.basic

Class Date

  • java.lang.Object
    • model.basic.Date
  • public class Date
extends java.lang.Object
    A class representing the date.
    Version:
    1 - 2 December 2021
    Author:
    Christian Foyer, Kamil Fischbach, Martin Rosendahl, Nina Wrona, Robert Barta

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Date()
      Overloaded zero-argument constructor creating a date object with today's date.
      Date​(int day, int month, int year)
      Three-argument constructor taking a day, month, year all being an integer type.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Date

        public Date​(int day,
            int month,
            int year)
        Three-argument constructor taking a day, month, year all being an integer type. If the date is before today, the exception is thrown as we cannot schedule a session for the past.
        Parameters:
        day - the day of the date
        month - the month of the date
        year - the year of the date

      • Date

        public Date()
        Overloaded zero-argument constructor creating a date object with today's date.

    • Method Detail

      • getWeekday

        public java.lang.String getWeekday()
        A method returning a String representing the name of the week day for this Date object.
        Returns:
        A String object containing the weekday name.

      • getWeekNumber

        public int getWeekNumber()
        A method returning an int representing the day of the week, wherein 1 is Monday and 7 is Sunday
        Returns:
        An int of the day of the week

      • isWeekend

        public boolean isWeekend()
        A boolean method checking if this Date object is a weekend.
        Returns:
        "True" if it is a day of the weekend, or "False" if it is not.

      • getDay

        public int getDay()
        A getter method returning the day.
        Returns:
        a day int

      • getMonth

        public int getMonth()
        A getter method returning a month object.
        Returns:
        a month int

      • getYear

        public int getYear()
        A getter method returning a year object.
        Returns:
        a year int

      • set

        public void set​(int day,
                int month,
                int year)
        A void method checking if the values for day, month, year are legal taking account for the leap year
        Parameters:
        day - a day int
        month - a month int
        year - a year int

      • numberOfDaysInMonth

        public int numberOfDaysInMonth()
        An int method checking for the number of days in month for month of this Date object.
        Returns:
        A number of days int

      • isLeapYear

        public boolean isLeapYear()
        A boolean method checking if the year of this Date object is a leap year.
        Returns:
        "True" when the year is a leap year. "False" when the year is not a leap year.

      • stepForwardOneDay

        public void stepForwardOneDay()
        A void method increasing the value of the day for this Date object by one.

      • stepForward

        public void stepForward​(int days)
        A void method increasing the value of the day for this Date object by the given parameter.
        Parameters:
        days - the number of the days to step forward.

      • copy

        public Date copy()
        A Date method creating a copy of this Date object.
        Returns:
        A Date object.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        A String method returning the day, month and year as a String in a proper format.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        A String object.

      • equals

        public boolean equals​(java.lang.Object obj)
        A boolean method taking an obj and comparing to this Date object.
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Parameters:
        obj - other Date object that we want to compare.
        Returns:
        "True" if the two Dates are identical. "False" if the obj is not a Date object or the two Dates are not identical.
